BOARD MEMBERS RALPH TRINE AND SHERI TRINE HAVE A >35% OWNERSHIP IN VESTIL MANUFACTURING CORP.

Paul Anthes serves as President of Financial Advisory Corporation (FAC) and serves as Secretary of Board of Trustees at IWU. FAC provides investment advisory services for University endowment funds. FAC does not serve as custodian or manager of invested funds and only provides advisory services which custodian(s) and/or fund manager(s) use. The University receives monthly investment statements directly from the custodian of the funds independent of FAC. Additionally, the University has adopted an investment management policy and regularly reviews investment performance and asset allocation within the parameters of this policy. Finally, as an additional measure of independence, FAC receives a set fee for their services and not a percentage of the earnings on the invested funds. Mr. Anthes does not serve on the investment committee of the board. Gary Ott is the President of Tender Love and Care Management, which manages the Wesleyan Retirement Center. Don Ott owns Interior Concepts, an office furniture vendor that IWU utilizes. The chairperson and the treasurer of the Wesleyan Retirement Center are both IWU employees.

ExplntnTxt: Loans to OfficersTo assist the president in obtaining a home adjacent to the Institute, the trustees approved a loan from the Institute in the amount of $500,000. This note has a rate of 4.0% per annum and is held as part of the Institute notes in the Operating fund. The president is currently paying interest only.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule L, Part IV, Column D
ExplntnTxt: Business Transactions involving interested parties. Name of Interested Person: US Foods Mount Sinai purchases a portion of its food from US Foodservice. All such purchases are made under a group purchasing organization (GPO) arrangement that has been negotiated with US Foods. These GPO prices are available to Mount Sinai and all other members of the local healthcare association. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Mr. Gogel and Mr. Kravis are CEOs of firms that are each indirectly a greater-than-35% owner of US Foods. Neither Mr. Gogel nor Mr. Kravis were involved in decisions related to the organization's purchases from U.S. Foods. Name of Interested Person: Hess Corporation Following an objective, competitive multi-party bidding process (in which Mr. Hess was uninvolved), the organization purchased natural gas and fuel oil from Hess Corporation. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Mr. Hess is Chief Executive Officer of, and has a financial interest in, Hess Corporation and remains uninvolved in the organization's decisions related to Hess Corporation. Name of Interested Person: XO Communications Following an extensive RFP and a multi-party competitive bidding process, as well as a review by a special board committee (which did not include Mr. Icahn) of the engagement process, the organization purchased communications services from XO Communications. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Mr. Icahn is a greater-than-35% owner of XO Communications. Mr. Icahn remains uninvolved in the organization's decisions related to XO Communications. Name of Interested Person: OCH Ziff Capital Management Mr. Windreich is a Director of Och Ziff Capital Management ("Och Ziff"), which manages investment capital for the organization. Mr. Windreich has no involvement in the organization's investment decisions or its involvement with Och Ziff. The fees charged by Och Ziff to the organization are in line with industry standards and are the same as the fees charged to other investors in the same fund. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Name of Interested Person: Avenue Capital Trustee Sonia Gardner and former Trustee Marc Lasry are 100% owners of Avenue Capital, which managed investment capital for the organization in 2013. The fees charged by Avenue Capital to the organization are in line with industry standards and are the same as the fees charged to other investors in the same fund. At all relevant times, Mount Sinai monitored this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance. Neither Ms. Gardner nor Mr. Lasry was involved in the organization's decisions related to Avenue Capital. Name of Interested Person: The Related Companies Following an extensive RFP and a multi-party competitive bidding process, as well as a review by a special board committee (which did not include Mr. Blau) of the engagement process, the organization purchased consulting and management services from The Related Companies ("TRC"). Mr. Blau is a Director of the general partner of TRC. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Mr. Blau remains uninvolved in the organization's decisions regarding The Related Companies. Name of Interested Person: Henry Schein Prior to Trustee Stanley Komaroff's membership on Mount Sinai's Board of Trustees, Mount Sinai entered into a multi-year agreement to purchase medical supplies from Henry Schein ("Schein"). The decision to engage Schein was the result of a competitive bidding process and business review meetings have been held with Schein management during the term of the contract in order to monitor the cost, quality and performance of Schein. Mr. Komaroff is an officer of Schein and remains uninvolved in Mount Sinai's decisions related to Schein. Name of Interested Person: Neuberger Berman Trustee Stanley Komaroff's son is an officer of the Neuberger Berman firm, which manages investment capital for the organization. Neither Mr. Komaroff nor his son are involved with the organization's investment decisions or its involvement with Neuberger Berman. The fees charged by Neuberger Berman to the organization are in line with industry standards and are the same as the fees charged to other investors in the same fund. Mount Sinai monitors this relationship for cost, quality and overall performance on an ongoing basis. Name of Interested Person: Gotham Construction Prior to Trustee Joel Picket's membership on Mount Sinai's Board of Trustees, Mount Sinai engaged subsidiary entity of the Gotham Organization, Inc. ("Gotham") to provide design and construction services to the organization. Mr. Picket is Chairman and CEO of Gotham and its subsidiary. At all relevant times, Mount Sinai monitored the performance of Gotham in order to ensure that it was satisfied with the quality and cost of those services. Mr. Picket remains uninvolved in the organization's decisions related to Gotham and its subsidiary. Name of Interested Person: Carolyn Sicher Trustee Susan Cullman's daughter is employed by the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. Ms. Cullman has no involvement in decisions related to her daughter's employment. Name of Interested Person: Kimberly Harrison Former Trustee Clifford Goldsmith's granddaughter is employed by the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. Mr. Goldsmith had no involvement in decisions related to his granddaughter's employment. Mr. Gribetz has no involvement in decisions related to his brother's employment. Mr. Kostegan has no involvement in decisions related to his wife's employment. Name of Interested Person: Brian Scanlon Officer Donald Scanlon's son is an employee of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Mr. Scanlon has no involvement in decisions related to his son's employment. Name of Interested Person: Gary B. Davis Officer Dr. Kenneth Davis' brother is an employee of the Hospital. Dr. Davis has no involvement in decisions related to his brother's employment. THE AMOUNTS DISCLOSED IN PART III OF SCHEDULE L REPRESENT THE VALUE OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO FAMILY MEMBERS OF THE LISTED OFFICERS OF THE COMPANY THAT ATTENDED A COLLEGE OPERATED BY THE COMPANY. THE SCHOLARSHIPS WERE AWARDED PURSUANT TO THE COMPANY'S EMPLOYEE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. THE DEPENDENT CHILDREN AND SPOUSES OF ELIGIBLE COMPANY EMPLOYEES MAY APPLY FOR SUCH SCHOLARSHIPS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE CHILD OR SPOUSE OF THE ELIGIBLE EMPLOYEE UPON APPROVAL OF THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION.

ALL OF THE TRANSACTIONS LISTED IN PART IV OF SCHEDULE L ARE A RESULT OF EITHER CONTRACTS THAT WERE ASSUMED WHEN THE COMPANY PURCHASED ASSETS PURSUANT TO THE ASSET PURCHASE AGREEMENT BETWEEN EDUCATION AMERICA, INC. AND THE COMPANY OR NEW CONTRACTS ENTERED INTO AT THE CLOSING OF THE ASSET PURCHASE. THE REAL ESTATE LEASES WERE FOR THE PROPERTIES THE COLLEGES PURCHASED BY THE COMPANY WERE OCCUPYING ON THE CLOSING DATE AND NEW LEASES WERE ENTERED TO FIX THE RENTAL AMOUNTS AND LEASE TERM FOR A PERIOD ACCEPTABLE TO THE COMPANY. THE LEASES WERE DETERMINED TO BE AT FAIR MARKET VALUE BY A THIRD PARTY VALUATION FIRM EMPLOYED BY THE COMPANY.

ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT IS CURRENTLY AN ADJUNCT PROFESSOR AT THE CALVARY CHAPEL BIBLE COLLEGE. CALVARY CHAPEL BIBLE COLLEGE AND CALVARY CHAPEL CONFERENCE CENTER ARE BOTH UNDER THE UMBRELLA OF CALVARY CHAPEL COSTA MESA, THE SAME ORGANIZATION THAT IS DONATING OFFICE SPACE AND LEASING THE ACADEMIC SPACE TO VERITAS EVANGELICAL SEMINARY.THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT CURRENTLY RECEIVES ROYALTY PAYMENTS FROM THE SALE OF TEXTBOOKS AND LECTURES THAT HE HAS PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED. THESE BOOKS ARE PURCHASED BY VERITAS EVANGELICAL SEMINARY DIRECTLY FROM THE PUBLISHER AND THEN THE COLLEGE PAYS THE PRESIDENT DIRECTLY FOR THE ROYALTIES. A TOTAL OF $5,440 IN ROYALTY PAYMENTS WERE MADE DURING 2013.
